text: is a Japanese politician. He was Chief Cabinet Secretary in the cabinet of Yoshirō Mori also served as Secretary-General of the LDP in the House of Councillors. He studied at Waseda University but did not graduate. He served as acting Prime Minister of Japan following Keizō Obuchi's coma in 2000. ==References== |- |- Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:20th-century Prime Ministers of Japan Category:People from Shimane Prefecture Category:Government ministers of Japan Category:Members of the House of Councillors (Japan) Category:Prime Ministers of Japan Category:Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) politicians Category:Waseda University alumni
title: Mikio Aoki
